alert.note: Alert for Coastal St. Lucie (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 04 at 8:51AM EDT by NWS Melbourne
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern St. Lucie County through 915 AM EDT... At 851 AM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Fort Pierce Inlet, moving northwest at 20 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Fort Pierce, Indrio, Fort Pierce Inlet, Queens Cove and Fort Pierce North. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Conditions are favorable for the development of weak, brief funnel clouds. These types of funnel clouds are harmless, but on rare occasions they can briefly touch down, producing wind gusts over 50 mph. If a funnel cloud is spotted move indoors and report your sighting to the National Weather Service.
